Practical pedagogical example with Rachel

Rachel wanted to make learning objectives clear, so she looked into the new digital literacy game in detail.

She was impressed by the beautiful user interface and storyline, where the player learned to read gradually.

The game had a personal learning path with constant feedback.

She thought that children would master the game quickly on school laptops, but she also planned time for them to practice using a mouse or keyboard.

She knew that the game focused on recognising and reading letters and words, but it was not enough to teach reading by itself.
